abstract_summ: Susceptible-Exposed-Infectious-Recovered (SEIR) model is used to forecast active COVID-19 cases in India considering the effect of nationwide lockdown and possible inflation in the active cases after its removal on May 3, 2020.Susceptible-Exposed-Infectious-Recovered (SEIR) model is used to forecast active COVID-19 cases in India considering the effect of nationwide lockdown and possible inflation in the active cases after its removal on May 3, 2020.As the ongoing COVID-19 outbreak remains a global threat, it is a challenge for all the countries to come up with effective public health and administrative strategies to battle against COVID-19 and sustain their economies.For India, it is an important decision to come up with a non-pharmaceutical control strategy such as nationwide lockdown for 40 days to prolong the higher phases of COVID-19 and to avoid severe load on its public health-care system.For India, it is an important decision to come up with a non-pharmaceutical control strategy such as nationwide lockdown for 40 days to prolong the higher phases of COVID-19 and to avoid severe load on its public health-care system.
title_summ: Population-scale testing can suppress the spread of COVID-19The timing of contact restrictions and pro-active testing balances the socio-economic impact of a lockdown with the control of infectionsInvestigating the dynamics of COVID-19 pandemic in India under lockdownCOVID-19 Epidemic Study II: Phased Emergence From the Lockdown in MumbaiStudy of lockdown/testing mitigation strategies on stochastic SIR model and its comparison with South Korea, Germany and New York dataPredicting optimal lockdown period with parametric approach using three-phase maturation SIRD model for COVID-19 pandemicInvestigating the dynamics of COVID-19 pandemic in India under lockdown
title_abstract_phrases: Susceptible-Exposed-Infectious-Recovered (SEIR) model is used to forecast active COVID-19 cases in India considering the effect of nationwide lockdown and possible inflation in the active cases after its removal on May 3, 2020.Susceptible-Exposed-Infectious-Recovered (SEIR) model is used to forecast active COVID-19 cases in India considering the effect of nationwide lockdown and possible inflation in the active cases after its removal on May 3, 2020.Predicting optimal lockdown period with parametric approach using three-phase maturation SIRD model for COVID-19 pandemicThis paper proposes a three-phase Susceptible-Infected-Recovered-Dead (SIRD) model to calculate an optimal lockdown period for some specific geographical regions that will be favorable to break not only the transmission chain but also will help country’s economy to recover and support infrastructure in a fight against COVID-19.The timing of contact restrictions and pro-active testing balances the socio-economic impact of a lockdown with the control of infectionsDuring the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic, numerous mathematical models have been developed.As the ongoing COVID-19 outbreak remains a global threat, it is a challenge for all the countries to come up with effective public health and administrative strategies to battle against COVID-19 and sustain their economies.
